page.title: 11Agriculture at Holbeach Bank
page.content: The land around here is mostly taken up with farmland.A lot of the crops are sold in other parts of the country by merchants because they make more money where people cannot grow their own.But some of the crops die of the sharp winter frosts.In spring the whole area is alive with tulips and daffodills. There are lots of small plots with an average of 10 acres.The biggest farm around here is Tinsley's. They own most of the fields and employ many people in their food processing works. Some of the fields around here have strawberries in the summer.The most valuable crops are wheat potatoes and sugar beet.People around here get good crops because the land is fertile. Some grow flowers to sell.They go to London, then to all parts of the country.
